intro: Enydra subcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-angled enydra, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its common name.
